name: Mini Spreadsheet
description:
In this kata, we are going to make a simple [Spreadsheet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spreadsheet) application.

Our Spreadsheet has only two methods: `read` and `write`.

The method `read` simply returns the value of a cell by its name.
```javascript
read(name)
```
A cell `name` is a string (e.g., "B5", "A12").

We can use the method `write` to update the value of a cell.
```javascript
write(name, value)
```
A cell `value` can be any type (string, number, boolean, etc.).

The good thing about Spreadsheets is that you don't have to update a cell manually every time, we can also use the method `write` to make the value of a cell depend on some other cells.
```javascript
write(name, dependencies, formula)
```
The `dependencies` is an array of strings (cell names) that a cell depends on.

The `formula` is a function to calculate the value of a cell using the value of its dependencies.

If any of the dependencies change, the cell should automatically update its value using the formula.

The method `write` returns an array of the affected cells (in any order).

The affected cells are the first cell to update and any other cell that depends on it, even if their values haven't actually changed.

Cycles are not allowed, if calling the method `write` can cause a cycle of cells that depends on each other, it does nothing and returns an empty array.

## Task
Implement a `Spreadsheet` class with two methods: `read` and `write` that meet the specifications above.

## Notes
- A sheet has an infinite number of cells
- The default value of any cell is the number `0`

## Hint
Update the cells in the correct order, so that no cell will update until all its dependencies are up-to-date.
